messages.content:
create a rank dashboard of the beans score of h4ks.com. Login to to the IRC server using websockets wss://irc.h4ks.com:8097 then do the basic nick and user setup for irc and ping, then join #bots and issue the command .topbeans. the user _cloudbot will display a message, take his output and display it, then leave the channel.
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

you should do a "PRIVMSG #bots :.topbeans" instead of ".topbeans."
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

use a good nickname instead like _robot_bean_score_fetcher_{random_number}
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

after joining the channel, and waiting for joining it, send `PRIVMSG #bots :.topbeans` to get the beans status
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

you are not sending anything to the channel for some reason
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Drop that channel joining logic and just DM _cloudbot like `privmsg _cloudbot :.topbeans`
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Automatically perform the score fetching and display the response from _cloudbot on entereing the page. Replace the button with a loading bar

display the response from _cloudbot then inside some html document, and close the connection

I see the response in the websockets but you are not displaying it anywhere in the document. Please just display the text somewhere so we can debug it inside the html document or console.log or both
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

check if a message starts with "_cloudbot!" to know it is the one you are looking for. Then get it's content by splitting by the ":" characeter first occurrence and get the remaining text. C'mon is just an irc privmsg, you can do it. If there is no match display "nothing found" in the page, otherwise the message
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

you are not waiting for the answer properly and quitting too early
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

dude remove the quitting, just wait for cloudbot to reply and display it with a timeout of 15 seconds, otherwise display failed to fetch, no quit
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

it shold start with ":_cloudbot!"
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

when you split you need to consider that the text can contain ":" so do like split(":", 1)[1] in python and only split the first occurrence. Maybe use regex instead
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

the message States with a a ":" so actually we need from the second ":" and so on
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

We still need to keep the rest of the message. Loop over the text until you see ":" a second time, then use all the rest of the text
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

now instead of displaying as it is lets create a nicer thing to display it on. Make it a nicely formated list considering the message is in the format: "🏆 Top Bean Holders: 1. handyc 🫘 (956 beans) | 2. mattf 🫘 (162 beans) | 3. loudercake 🫘 (49 beans) | 4. valware 🫘 (40 beans) | 5. obsidianirc 🫘 (20 beans) | 6. hanb 🫘
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

remove the emojis, look for the number in the parenthesis, create a better design for displaying it as a list with less text around it, just rank, user name and bean count
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

I see nothing in your list. The response is like "🏆 Top Bean Holders: 1. handyc 🫘 (725 beans) | 2. mattf 🫘 (180 beans) | 3. loudercake 🫘 (110 beans) | 4. doesnm 🫘 (60 beans)" build a parser for that

just match on /^:[^:]:(.*)/ instead, doesn't seem like you are finding the output

your regex for the rows parts seem to be not working. Add more logging so I can find out why

do not quit. Keep asking _cloudbot every 10 seconds for the lastest scoreboard and rebuild the list every time. This way it keeps live up to date.
